supporting_text: The NAP has been prepared to present the current and planned national strategies and activities for response to AMR in the human and animal health sectors as well as the food and environment sectors in the UAE.
The NAP mentions specific actions in the human health sector, including improving awareness of AMR and promoting behavioral change at the public and professional levels.
The NAP includes strategies for antimicrobial stewardship programs in the animal health sector.
The NAP addresses the environment sector by promoting the prudent use of antimicrobials and implementing biosafety rules.
The NAP includes actions related to antimicrobial use in agriculture and food safety.
The NAP outlines a monitoring and evaluation plan that includes performance indicators, targets, and timelines.
The NAP includes specific targets and timelines for various activities related to AMR.
The NAP includes quantitative targets for AMR surveillance and antimicrobial use in various sectors.
The NAP includes a budget breakdown for different activities listed in the operational plan.
The NAP includes an economic case that assesses future budget requirements for various activities.
The NAP establishes a National Multi-sectoral Committee Group (NMCG) for the governance of the plan.
The NAP includes actions related to the legislative framework for antimicrobial use in both human and animal health.
The NAP includes strategies for integrating AMR education into medical and veterinary curricula.
The NAP outlines public awareness campaigns to improve knowledge about AMR among the general public.
The NAP emphasizes collaboration with international organizations such as WHO, FAO, and OIE.
The NAP includes strategies for developing AMR surveillance systems and data collection tools.
The NAP includes actions to enhance laboratory capacity for detecting and reporting AMR.
The NAP includes strategies for infection prevention and control (IPC) in healthcare settings.
The NAP aligns with international standards and guidelines for AMR control.
The NAP includes regulations for the prescription and dispensation of antibiotics.
The NAP includes strategies to promote the rational use of antibiotics.
The NAP emphasizes the importance of international collaboration in research for new medicines and diagnostics.
